storyPoints.label: Start
storyPoints.story: Leaving Clamart before sunrise to take a train, metro, fast train, slower train, short train, and a bus. But let's take it step by step.

storyPoints.label: Lac du Bourget
storyPoints.story: TGV to Lyon was fast, comfortable, and uneventful. Slower train to Annecy offered some breathtaking views of the Lake Bourget.

storyPoints.label: Views from train
storyPoints.story: Honestly, I just need more of those train rides in Savoie. The train went to Switzerland, while I got off at the small station of Groisy-Thorens-la-Caille. Just one more bus and I can finally start!

storyPoints.label: Real start
storyPoints.story: Aviernoz! Start strava recording, open mapy.com, all is set, let the hike begin!

storyPoints.label: Fields and gardens
storyPoints.story: Пробираюсь огородами, стараюсь сильно не разгоняться, сразу же влезла в крапиву. Людей не видно, коров слышно.

storyPoints.label: Sandwich
storyPoints.story: Nice place to eat a sandwich (I brought them from Paris), drink some water, and enjoy a view of the lake where I came from and the mountain where I'm heading to. From now on the trail gets more populated and better marked. The route to Parmelan is popular, but I came on Friday, so I guess that's why it wasn't too crowded.

storyPoints.label: Cow band
storyPoints.story: Cool cows. They have bells sounding angelically, but when you get close, you can also hear the endless buzz of many flies that swirl around. Poor cows!:(
